Tucson couldn't help but keep an air of apprehension in his movements, yet =
he eases somewhat as his question is answered.  There was someone in the CR=
 chamber.  He steps away still with a defensive stance.

" Thanks for the u=
pdate, guys.  But something tells me that there could be someone else here =
besides the Maximal in the CR Chamber.  I pickedup on another voice in this=
 vicinity, and I don't think it's friendly."

He uses his sonar systems to =
hear if more than one ping bounces back on it.  Sure enough, he gets two pi=
ngs instead of one.  

" I knew it.  All right, fun's over!  You called me =
pathetic and now you lay in hiding somewhere in this vicinity!  I'm not tol=
erating your charades and there's no way in the name of Primus I'm going to=
 let you harm my comrades or any surviving Maximal in this base! I demand t=
hat you show yourself immediately!" 

He places himself in front of the CR =
chamber, as any Autobot would do, to stand guard vigilantly.  Yet, he knows=
 not to open fire in the base so is not to harm any innocent bistanders ins=
ide the complex.

"Tucson to Perseus, The base seems abandoned yet, there i=
s a Maximal down here inside.  But there's something else here and hasn't m=
ade itself visible yet.  In fact, I might have been the only one to hear hi=
m..  I'm sending you my sonar data now. "

He interfaces with the computer =
on Lord Perseus's ship, and downloads his data, showing the two pings he ha=
d picked up using his sonar equipment.
